newsitem.title: USA: PAXAR CEO sees Q1 shr in line with estimates.
newsitem.headline: PAXAR CEO sees Q1 shr in line with estimates.

text.p: PAXAR Corp chief executive officer, Arthur Hershaft said Monday the company's strong international business and a strong domestic retail environment will contribute to first quarter earnings per share in line with Wall Street estimates of $0.19 to $0.21 a share.
The company earned $0.15 a share in the year ago first quarter, after an adjustment to reflect stock dividends.

"Our international business is much stronger than it was a year ago," Hershaft said. And the better retail environment in the United States will benefit earnings. Paxar is the world's largest manufacturer of apparel labels.
"In the end we're really driven by the retail environment," he said.
The company expects to report first quarter earnings April 23.
